intro: Perilepta longgangensis, commonly known as the Longgang perilepta, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
